medical_history.chief_complaint: Acute onset epigastric and right upper quadrant pain with nausea and vomiting.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 8 hours prior to presentation after dinner, described as acute with pain radiating to the right back. There were no fever, chills, jaundice, hematochezia, melena, or change in bowel habits/urine color. History of 2 previous episodes of similar pain treated with antibiotics.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Chronic back pain, chronic constipation, history of falls, history of uterine bleeding, hemorrhoids/anal fissure, arthritis, past surgical history includes appendectomy, laparotomy, and colonoscopy.
medical_history.family_history: Diabetes Mellitus, Lung Cancer, Uterine Cancer.
